participant_abstract.sent: Poppy started things off with a presentation on components design.
She outlined the functional parts of the circuit board: diodes, transistors, resonators, resistors, capacitors and LED, as well as the importance of an integrated circuit (the main chip).
Poppy spoke of varoius energy source options, including basic battery, kinetic energy, solar power, and hand-powered dynamo.
We ruled out the last two.
She went on to discuss the case, where our options are plastic, rubber, wood and titanium.
Again we ruled out the last two and agreed on a combination of plastic and rubber.
Moving on to buttons, Poppy explained the differences between simple, regular and advanced electronics for running the buttons- based on previous decisions, we will be using regular.
She explained that user interface is the aspect of a system which is seen and/or perceived by the user, as well as the commands accessed by the user to control and in-put data.
There are two types of interface, graphical and comman, however we will be dealing with comman as it is more relevant for a remote control, not to mention cheaper and simpler.
She warned us about the tendency of remote control creators to design products that are too cluttered.

We went on to discuss the details of the buttons, i.e. will they be a part of the rubber casing or on the solid remote control skeleton?, should the style/colour change?, how large and what kind of tactility?
I gave the marketing update last.
I spoke about our priorities of creating a remote that has a fancy look-and-feel, is technologically innovative and easy-to-use.
I also reported that fruits and vegetables are the newest trend in Milan and Paris.
Heather concluded the meeting by asking the designers to come up with a prototype.
I will be writing a marketing product evaluation.

participant_actions.sent: I will draft a marketing product evaluation.
Product manager will calculate the costs.

participant_decisions.sent: We will use kinetic power, which is one of the newest energy sources.
It will involve the user shaking the remote to energize it.
This fits in with our mandate to create a product that is technologically innovative.
The main structure of the remote will be in hard plastic.
The casing and buttons material will be rubber.
This has several benefits, mainly: -provides additional protective layer if remote is dropped.
Easy to create unique designs on the rubber casing.
Minimizes effects of RSI. -buttons will be simple electronics, however the LED will mean the use of regular electronics.
Command interface is simpler, cheaper and more effective, so we're going with that.
We will avoid a clutter of buttons.
Marketing will involve promoting the hassle-free, minimal buttons approach.
